intro.p: Consider the system of linear equations \begin{array}{rcl}{{lhs1}} &=& {{rhs1}}\\{{lhs2}} &= &{{rhs2}}\end{array}.

content.p: Before you look for its solution, determine which of the six graphs (1)-(6) in the image below best describes the nature of this system of two equations. Explain your choice in 2-3 sentences. (Hint: Think first about the slope of each equation.)

image.description: Six types of linear system graphs

content.p: Use either a substitution or an elimination method, showing and explaining each of your steps, to determine the solution of this system, if it has one.
If it has no solution, or infinitely many solutions, clearly demonstrate how you can tell.
